q: The next step is to reduce U.S. unemployment, an issue Barack Obama should make`` the centerpiece'' of his annual State of the Union address on Jan. 25, the former Cabinet member said. The American people are expecting him to say something about what he's going to do to keep the economy moving forward, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell has criticized his own party in recent months while supporting Barack Obama 's ultimately successful fight for Senate ratification of a new nuclear-arms-reduction treaty with Russia. The former Pentagon chief's comments came in his first television interview since leaving public life in December 2006 after a long and divisive tenure at the Pentagon. They largely echoed his

many important things we did accomplish, I regret that I did not leave at that point.'' Rumsfeld also faulted the administration for failing to work with Congress on drafting policies for treatment of prisoners. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, he wrote. The accounts of the book also quote Rumsfeld as criticizing his colleagues in the President Bush administration, including both of President Bush 's secretaries of state, Colin Powell and later Condoleezza Rice .
